cons: Hard to move up, very busy

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fresno, CA
cons: under paying staff conpared to travelers

pros: I think the pros include good pay, great employee treatment, and room for growth.
cons: The cons include changing shifts and lots of typing.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fresno, CA
pros: team worker, good to work on floor

One really big advantage of this employer is that there is no micromanagement and you are trusted to know your job and do it. It is a great place for getting experience because if you can do your job successfully at this hospital then you can do it anywhere. The equipment is sort of old and you have to make due with supplies. I really enjoy learning my career at this place but it's not somewhere I will stay permanently.
cons: No room for advancement, limited supplies, and terrible communication among all the staff.

pros:
Worked at CRMC for 4 years in the ER. The staff worked together as a team to get through the day. 
Great People to work with. I could always count on having help when tough cases rolled in.
Top Notch MDs
cons: We had to improvise a lot when it came to supplies. Also there was a huge push to get pts out the door and turn over beds just to get a whole new set of pts.

review_title: Great Company, Terrible supervisors and Management.
pros: Excellent benefits.  Employee Gym.  Pretty accommodating with schedules.
cons: Supervisors and Nurses are always looking out for themselves. Most of the time completely are completely inept and have no problem fabricating to save themselves at your expense. Very cliqueish and are harder on subordinates if the subordinates don't fit in with the cliques.

pros:
If you are part of a clique you may have a positive work experience. (Until your leader is fired)
Pay is ok, benefits are mediocre.
cons:
If you are not part of a clique you will likely not have a positive experience. It may seem so at first, but wait.
And don't be fooled into thinking being a great employee and very good at what you do will save you. But it and keeping a very low profile may buy you some time.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Aransas Pass, TX
pros: Good training, learn to think critically and how to handle most situations, co-workers were nice.
cons: Not really room for advancement and no raises
